title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 650.2 - Operational and service requirements
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 650.2 - Operational and service requirements

State Regulations

The following operational requirements shall apply to
payphones: (a) access to intraLATA
directory assistance shall be provided; (b) calls to the 911 emergency number, to an
operator, and to relay centers providing service to persons with speech, hearing, or other disabilities shall be completed at no charge to payphone end
users. When "9-1-1" is dialed from a payphone, the payphone must input a signal
for a 911 call to the local exchange network with no perceptible delay. When a
payphone end user dials "0," if no further digits are dialed within five
seconds the call must be routed either to a local exchange carrier operator or
to an operator services provider authorized by the commission to receive such
calls. If additional digits are dialed by the caller within five seconds after
dialing "0," the call may be routed at the discretion of the payphone service
provider; and
(c) payphones, which
are serviced by dedicated exchange access lines, shall be connected to the
telephone network by means of metered or measured service access lines, or
specially rated flat rate lines in situations where measured service is not
available, offered pursuant to tariffs by local exchange carriers, and
hereinafter referred to as "public access lines." Such public access lines are
subject to the same regulatory requirements as other access line services
provided by local exchange carriers. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16
ยง
650.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
